title: "The decision has already been made" - Romelu Lukaku speaks on his Everton future
text:

Romelu Lukaku says “the decision has already been made” over his future. 
The Belgian striker, the Premier League’s top scorer this season, looked set to sign a new contract with Everton last month. 
The player’s agent, Mino Raiola, had claimed a deal to extend his stay at Goodison Park was “99.9 per cent agreed”.However, Lukaku has since told Everton that he will not be signing a new deal. 
The 21-goal hitman has decided that his future lies away from Merseyside and won't commit to a new five-year contract. 
When asked on Friday about the situation, Lukaku responded: "The decision has already been made so I can't talk about that.” Everton's Romelu Lukaku celebrates another two goals last weekend (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Lukaku's refusal to sign new contract is 'not an issue,' claims Farhad Moshiri 
But one week after criticising Everton’s ambition to challenge for top players, Lukaku has been forced to defend his own ambition, having publicly stated his desire to play in the Champions League. 
"There is nothing wrong with ambition. You have to embrace it and where you are as a footballer," he said. 
"I've made a long way until now but the road is still long and I know I have to improve and get better. I want to help Everton as much as I can, as well as the national team. I think a lot of stuff can be achieved. 
"Sometimes people will mistake things that I say but it's just ambition that I have; I want to win titles and trophies and I don't think people should take that as arrogance -- people should embrace it. 
"This is what footballers need to achieve if they want to become the best, and I think young kids need to learn that too." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
